comment.author: 61614891@N06
comment._content: I waited most of the day to get this photo, because an earlier flight that day had a substitute American prop aircraft without markings.  This airline served only one route at the time, as I recall, from a moderate OK city west of Tulsa (Ponca City?).  Here I asked the police for permission to go on the ramp, and they were most cooperative.  There can't be many photos out there of this short-lived operation.

comment.author: 61614891@N06
comment._content: This airline was known as Jetstream Commuter, and its main route was Tulsa-Oklahoma City-Dallas (Love), continuing to Waco.  My comment about Ponca City above seems to stem from confusing this airline with another that ran under the sponsorship of an oil company.  I believe this airline only lasted about a month after this photo was taken, having started operations in April 1974.
